p: The present study confirmed an emerging burden of HM incidence among anaemic patients with an estimated incidence rate of 60%. This magnitude was almost eight-fold higher than the HM incidence of 8.7% reported for sub-Saharan Africa in 2008 [ 1, 20]. The present Congolese epidemic of HM (an incidence rate of 60% in 2016) was already close to the HM incidence rate projected to be 75% by 2030 for all of sub-Saharan Africa [ 1, 7]. Among the patients with incident HM ( n = 63), this study confirmed AML and MM as the most prevalent malignancies, which is similar to previous reports from Kinshasa, DRC and other parts of Africa [ 1, 6, 11].
